description: What does an office have in common with hotels, residential clubhouses, F&B spaces, and retail? We invite you to an open studio at Conran and Partners to examine how design increasingly blurs traditional sector boundaries. Experience a journey through spaces that shift from public to private, reflecting how the modern workplace has evolved into a lifestyle choice.

events.name: Drop in: Exhibition
events.notes: Using mixed media including pin-ups, sketches, material palettes, and digital tools, attendees will gain insights into the power of design.

events.name: Panel Talk
events.notes: Blurred boundaries - How can brands and developers make use of transitional spaces to create a sense of community?

facilities: Handrails on both sides of stairs

factsheet.heading: Exhibition & Panel Talk
paragraphs: Architecture and interior design studio Conran and Partners opens the doors to its Clerkenwell studio to present Blurred Boundaries. The exhibition explores the evolution of the workplace by comparing it with other aspects of lifestyle — hospitality, residential clubhouses, F&B spaces, and retail — as a journey from public to private, passing through semi-public spaces. Using mixed media including pin-ups, sketches, material palettes, and digital tools, attendees will gain insights into the power of design to foster community spirit and improve wellbeing at work. Following the exhibition, which is open to everyone without registration, Conran and Partners will host a panel talk to gain further insights on the topic from leaders in the fields of design and placemaking.

name: Blurred boundaries
